Welcome to GeekHOME!

Thanks for using our products and services (“Services”). The Services are provided by GeekHOME Sp z o.o. (“GeekHOME”), located at 184 Dziekanowice, 32-086 Dziekanowice, Lesser Poland, Cracow.

By using our Services, you are agreeing to these terms. Please read them carefully.

Terms and Conditions

Our Warranties and Disclaimers

We provide our Services using a commercially reasonable level of skill and care and we hope that you will enjoy using them. But there are certain things that we do not promise about our Services.

NEITHER GEEKHOME NOR ITS SUPPLIERS OR DISTRIBUTORS MAKES ANY SPECIFIC PROMISES ABOUT THE SERVICES. FOR EXAMPLE, WE DO NOT MAKE ANY COMMITMENTS ABOUT THE CONTENT WITHIN THE SERVICES, THE SPECIFIC FUNCTIONS OF THE SERVICES OR THEIR RELIABILITY, AVAILABILITY OR ABILITY TO MEET YOUR NEEDS. WE PROVIDE THE SERVICES “AS IS”.

SOME JURISDICTIONS PROVIDE FOR CERTAIN WARRANTIES, LIKE THE IMPLIED WARRANTY OF MERCHANTABILITY, FITNESS FOR A PARTICULAR PURPOSE AND NON-INFRINGEMENT. TO THE EXTENT PERMITTED BY LAW, WE EXCLUDE ALL WARRANTIES.

Liability for our Services

WHEN PERMITTED BY LAW, GEEKHOME AND GEEKHOME’S SUPPLIERS AND DISTRIBUTORS WILL NOT BE RESPONSIBLE FOR LOST PROFITS, REVENUES OR DATA, FINANCIAL LOSSES OR INDIRECT, SPECIAL, CONSEQUENTIAL, EXEMPLARY OR PUNITIVE DAMAGES.

TO THE EXTENT PERMITTED BY LAW, THE TOTAL LIABILITY OF GEEKHOME AND ITS SUPPLIERS AND DISTRIBUTORS FOR ANY CLAIMS UNDER THESE TERMS, INCLUDING FOR ANY IMPLIED WARRANTIES, IS LIMITED TO THE AMOUNT THAT YOU PAID US TO USE THE SERVICES (OR, IF WE CHOOSE, TO SUPPLYING YOU WITH THE SERVICES AGAIN).

IN ALL CASES, GEEKHOME AND ITS SUPPLIERS AND DISTRIBUTORS WILL NOT BE LIABLE FOR ANY LOSS OR DAMAGE THAT IS NOT REASONABLY FORESEEABLE.

Privacy policy

When you use GeekHOME automation and IoT system, you trust us with your information. This Privacy Policy is meant to help you understand what data we collect, why we collect it and what we do with it.

Definitions

House configuration schema - contains all necessary information about how floors and rooms are located in the building, devices, automation conditions, modes, alerts and other configuration items defined by the user during system setup.

Third party accounts data - all information required to third party services to work (eg. cloud access, controlling the building using email or internet messaging) defined by the user during system setup.

Sensor readings - all data readings from GeekHOME controlled sensors and actuators.

Cloud configuration backup - a internet service providing configuration backup in internet network

Cloud device access - a internet service providing possibility to control devices from any place with internet connection

Personal data - all the information about the user like firstname, lastname, email address, geekHOME account password and acquired license data

Information that we collect

While using GeekHOME automation and IoT system, different types of information are collected: from house schema to third party account data.

We collect information in the following ways:/p>

GeekHOME Asymptote sensor control app – the app collects third party accounts data (user account) and paired sensors metadata. All data is secured and stored in the Google Firebase cloud, managed by geekHOME Administrator.

GeekHOME home automation server – the app collects house schema, third party accounts configuration and sensors data. House schema is stored in two places: locally and in the cloud (as a backup). All settings (third party accounts data) are stored locally only.

GeekHOME Pilot - the home control app collects are house schema and xmpp account data (which is required to connect controlled house with GeekHOME Pilot app together via internet network). All data is stored locally on device (smartphone or tablet) memory.

GeekHOME license - contains user data that are required to validate the license. The data is stored in the cloud only. We restrict access to personal information to GeekHOME employees only.

How we use information that we collect

We collect only the information required to GeekHOME to work correctly. We don\'t process this information to extract details that are not relevant to the GeekHOME automation system during it\'s normal work.

Information security

We work hard to protect GeekHOME company and our users from unauthorised access to or unauthorised alteration, disclosure or destruction of information that we hold. In particular:

• We encrypt many of our services using SSL.
• The devices that are sensitive to security (eg. code locks or gates) are protected by additional code which is required to change its state.
• We review our information collection, storage and processing practices, including physical security measures, to guard against unauthorised access to system.
• We restrict access to personal information to GeekHOME employees, contractors and agents who need to know that information in order to process it for us and who are subject to strict contractual confidentiality obligations. They may be disciplined or their contract terminated if they fail to meet these obligations.

Changes

Our Privacy Policy may change from time to time. We will not reduce your rights under this Privacy Policy without your explicit consent. We will post any Privacy Policy changes on http://geekhome.eu page and, if the changes are significant, we will provide a more prominent notice (including, for certain services, email notification of Privacy Policy changes).

Turns relay on when temperature is too high.
Turns relay on when temperature is too low.
Turns relay on when humidity is too high.
Turns relay on when humidity is too low.

Turns relay on when temperature goes above target value.
Turns relay on when humidity goes below target value.
Turns relay on when humidity goes above target value.
IoT/WiFi sensor of temperature, humidity, luminosity, noise and dust.

For security reasons you cannot unlock the device. You can still reset it to factory default by following these steps:
1) Press and hold pairing button on the device for few seconds (until status led starts blinking)
2) Release the button and wait till status led stops blinking (about 45 secs). Don't add any new device during that time!
3) Device should reboot and signal no Wi-Fi error (two short blinks) - now you can add device again.
Cannot change firmware on a device that\'s not locked because of security reasons. Please lock this device first.
This is not the latest version, please update!
When status led is off (no blinking) it means device has no power or is broken.

string-array.name: signal_none_solutions
string-array.item: Make sure device is connected to mains (if not, plug it in)
If the signal led is still off and power is connected, device may be broken. Please return it to supplier.

resources.string: Led is blinking when device is during long-running operations like pairing (smart-config) or over the air update are in progress.

string-array.name: signal_blinking_solutions
string-array.item: Please wait for a while (till operation ends).
If device is blinking for more than 5 minutes, cut the power off turn it on.

resources.string: One blink means device can connect to your WiFi network and to the Cloud (if firmware requires cloud connection).

string-array.name: signal_1blink_solutions
string-array.item: The problem can be related with your account. If device is locked you need to be sure that it\'s been locked by you (which means you own the device)!
If device is running WiFi firmware, it can be restored to factory defaults and than locked by you. Restoring device to factory defaults requires physical access to it.
If device is running Cloud firmware that means device is connected to other user\'s account (are you using correct account to sign in?).
In rare cases, device might have been corrupted during Over the air update. You can still reset it to defaults (when on WiFi firmware).
In rare cases, when running Cloud firmware you can restore WiFi firmware and than reset the device.

string-array.name: reset_procedure
string-array.item: Press and hold pairing button on the device for few seconds (until status led starts blinking).
Release the button and wait till status led stops blinking (about 45 secs). Don\'t add/pair any other devices during that time!
Device should reboot and signal no Wi-Fi error (two blinks) - now you can pair/add device gain.

resources.string: Status led is blinking 2 times. This means device cannot connect to WiFi network.

string-array.name: signal_2blinks_solutions
string-array.item: Pair device with your WiFi network by clicking "+" button on main screen and follow pairing procedure.

resources.string: Status led is blinking 3 times. This means device is running Cloud firmware, can connect to your Wifi network but the problem is with connecting to the Cloud.

string-array.name: signal_3blinks_solutions
string-array.item: Make sure your internet provider is working (you can browse external sites like google.com, wikipedia.org when connected to your WiFi).

Please wait for a while (even an hour). If there were connection errors, device will save the power and tries to reconnect within 30 minutes. You can reset device manually (by cutting power off and turning it on) to reconnect immediately.
If Cloud firmware is still making you a problem, consider restoring WiFi firmware.
If problem still persists just let us know using support form (Cloud provider may be broken).

resources.string: Status led is blinking 4 times. This means device is running Cloud firmware, can connect to your Wifi network but the Cloud certificate is renewed or expired. Device security data must be updated.

string-array.name: signal_4blinks_solutions
string-array.item: While connected to your WiFi, sign in to the app (don\'t use emergency mode).
Wait till device discovery is over (60 seconds)
The system should detect that there\'s a device in your network that cannot connect to the internet.
Offline device should show on the list (with a special note about certificate renewal).
Click \'Update certificate\' and wait.
After few seconds, certificate should be updated and device should show on the list.

resources.string: Signal led is on when trying to connect to your WiFi network.
This is emergency mode. User profile is unavailable.
Emergency password help in securing your devices from unauthorized access and malware. Emergency password is shared between all geekHOME Asymptote devices in local network.

This is emergency mode. Changing firmware is unavailable.
Do you want to restore WiFi firmware on this device?
Stock firmware, best reliability. Can work without internet connection. Security level is high.
Alternative firmware, reliability limited to your internet connection and cloud vendor (Google Firebase). Security level is high.
Hybrid firmware, devices can be controlled from LAN and Cloud at once. Security level is medium.
Remove this color from the list?
Selected color cannot be removed. You can remove other colors.
Warning, the IoT variant is now deprecated and will be removed in next release. Please migrate any IoT only devices to LAN+IoT.
Please update this device to latest version.
Please sign in and update this device to latest version.
Changes device state on defined date and time
Changes device state according to weekly schedule
Change relay state at specific time
Change relay state according to schedule

string-array.name: signal_turned_on_solutions
string-array.item: Please wait for more meaningful signal. Like when wifi is not configured device will turn on for few seconds and than blinks two times and turns on for few seconds again. The meaningful signal is two blinks in this case (also see 2 blinks scenario)
